Title: One Pot Pasta Recipe
Blog Intro: Making a simple and inexpensive meal can be very tricky. Therefore, I would like to introduce a recipe that is easy to make and delicious, requiring only one pot and easy-to-find ingredients. Here is a simple and inexpensive recipe that you can cook easily:
Blog Content:
Ingredients:

  • 1 pound spaghetti
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 can diced tomatoes
  • 1 teaspoon dried basil
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil

Instructions:

  1. In a large pot, sauté onions and garlic in olive oil over medium heat until soft and fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
  2. Add the vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, dried basil, dried oregano, red pepper flakes, and a pinch of salt and pepper to the pot. Stir well to combine.
  3. Break the spaghetti in half and add it to the pot, making sure to stir it well so that it doesn't stick together. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  4. Reduce the heat to low and let the pasta simmer for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is tender and most of the liquid has been absorbed.
  5. Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the grated parmesan cheese. Serve hot and enjoy!

This one-pot pasta recipe is an easy and affordable meal that you can whip up in no time. Plus, it's versatile – you can add any vegetables or protein that you have on hand to make it even more filling and nutritious.
